newsitem.title: USA: Dickson offers to buy Barney's - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Dickson offers to buy Barney's - NYT.

text.p: Hong Kong's Dickson Concepts Ltd has made an initial offer to buy Barney's Inc, the New York Times reported Friday.
Citing unidentified sources, the newspaper said the offer could be between $300 million and $400 million, although no price has been revealed.
It was not clear whether the offering price included the company's buildings or its Asia license, which is valued at $200 million, it added.
The newspaper said retail giant Dickson had told investment bank Blackstone Group, which is advising Barney's, of its interest in buying the company.
In response to the article, Barney's issued a two-sentence statement, declining to comment.
"We don't respond to rumors or speculation," it said. "Barneys' investor process is private and designed to maximize value."
Barney's, which is based in New York, filed for bankruptcy protection in January.
